Google is helping AI Mode to provide more personalized responses in Search by allowing the chatbot to analyze your Gmail and Google Photos accounts. After launching for Gemini AI last week, "Personal Inâ€¦

items.title: Bebe Rexha Strikes Partnership With Empire Label
items.summary: Four-time Grammy-nominated pop artist and singer-songwriter Bebe Rexha has gone indie and entered a partnership with powerhouse Bay Area-based label and distributor Empire. She joins after three albums on Warner Records and hits like â€œMeant to Be,â€ â€œIâ€™m A Mess,â€ â€œMe, Myself, and I,â€ â€œIâ€™m Good (Blueâ€¦

items.title: Nicoll named first British monobob Olympian
items.summary: Welsh athlete Adele Nicoll will be the first British female to compete at a Winter Olympics in monobob at next month's Milan-Cortina Games.

items.summary: vivo's upcoming V70 family will be quite large, and one of its members is the V70 FE. This one has the model number V2550, as revealed by a certification earlier this month. Now the V70 FE has received its European Energy Label, which reveals that it comes with a 7,000 mAh battery. This will be theâ€¦

items.title: I couldn't see, taste or smell for years - Gaethje
items.summary: Justin Gaethje says he couldn't "see things for years" until surgery after being born short-sighted in one eye and long-sighted in the other.

items.title: Lenovo wants other companies to make accessories for its modular laptops.
items.summary: Two years ago, Lenovo introduced a collection of modular Magic Bay accessories for its ThinkBook 16p. They attached to a magnetic pin connector at the top of the laptop's display and added functionality like an improved 4K webcam, or LTE connectivity. The company has since expanded Magic Bay compatâ€¦

items.title: Is holding Afcon every four years 'totally wrong' or 'good call'?
items.summary: The announcement that the Africa Cup of Nations will be hosted every four years from 2028 sparked division, but what will it mean for the game on the continent?

items.title: AMDâ€™s faster Ryzen 7 9850X3D CPU arrives on January 29th for $499
items.summary: AMD announced an improved version of its popular Ryzen 7 9800X3D processor at CES earlier this month, and it's now confirming a release date and pricing today. The new Ryzen 7 9850X3D will debut on January 29th, priced at $499. That's $20 more than the initial retail pricing of the 9800X3D, and thiâ€¦

items.title: UFC star Gaethje's 'life-changing' surgery that enabled him to see
items.summary: UFC star Justin Gaethje explains how he was born short-sighted in one eye and long-sighted in the other, which severely affected his depth perception for the first half of his career.

items.title: Caluori aims for England debut inside six months - then greatness
items.summary: Noah Caluori believes he needs to make his England senior debut over the next six months to stay on track for his ambition to be one of the game's great wings.

items.title: This plugin uses Wikipedia’s AI-spotting guide to make AI writing sound more human
items.summary: A new tool aims to help AI chatbots generate more human-sounding text - with the help of Wikipedia's guide for detecting AI, as reported by Ars Technica. Developer Siqi Chen says he created the tool, called Humanizer, by feeding Anthropic's Claude the list of tells that Wikipedia's volunteer editorâ€¦

items.title: Samsung is saving its best displays for iPhones, not Galaxies
items.summary: A new rumor from China suggests that Samsung will be supplying Apple with its very best OLED panels for the iPhone 18 lineup. Reportedly, they will be significantly brighter and BOE is struggling to meet Apple's brightness requirements, so panel production will be shifted to Samsung and possibly LGâ€¦

items.title: Humour, optimism & learnings - how do you end a one-sided record?

items.title: Redmi Turbo 5 runs Geekbench, confirms its chipset
items.summary: Redmi has been teasing the Turbo 5 Max for a while now, but this model won't be launching alone. Instead, it will be joined by the 'vanilla' Turbo 5, which now seems to have run Geekbench. This means there's an online listing for it in the benchmark's database, and you can see it in the screenshot â€¦

items.title: Xiaomi 17 Ultra Leica Edition review
OnePlus officially denies rumors about its shutdown
items.summary: A recent article by Android Headlines that covers three continents and collects data from four independent analyst firms suggests that OnePlus will soon shut down. The poor sales performance in the last couple of years, the fact that OnePlus is losing market share, and the closure of many offices aâ€¦

items.title: Elon Musk's xAI Colossus 2 is nowhere near 1 gigawatt capacity, satellite imagery suggests â€” despite claims, site only has 350 megawatts of cooling capacity
items.summary: Despite Elon Musk's claim that xAIâ€™s Colossus 2 has already reached a 1 GW scale, satellite analysis by Epoch AI indicates the supercomputer is still far below that level due to limited cooling capacity.

items.title: V-Color Manta XFinity RGB DDR5-6400 C32 2x64GB Review: Two-Module Powerhouse
items.summary: The Manta XFinity RGB DDR5-6400 ranks among the fastest 128GB memory kits available today. But does it truly live up to the hype?

items.title: The talking points from Ireland's Six Nations squad
items.summary: Andy Farrell has named his Ireland squad for the 2026 Six Nations, but what are the big talking points from his selection?

items.title: Huawei is apparently working on a new professional sport watch
items.summary: According to the latest rumors from China, Huawei is working on a new watch, which will be positioned as a professional sport-focused instrument. It is allegedly codenamed Chitu, and will be offered in four colorways, roughly translating from Chinese as Track Legend, Fast Shadow Black, Dawn Orange,â€¦

items.title: Intel axes 12th Gen Alder Lake and 4th Gen Xeon Sapphire Rapids â€” final orders for Intel's first hybrid CPUs end in just a few months
items.summary: Intel's 12th Generation Alder Lake and 4th Generation Xeon Sapphire Rapids Scalable processors have reached end-of-life (EOL) status.

items.title: Chinese semiconductor industry gears up for domestic HBM3 production by the end of 2026 â€” CXMT to produce chips, while Naura, Maxwell, and U-Preseason design tools for assembly
items.summary: The Chinese semiconductor industry is working to localize production of HBM3 memory, in addition to the tools required for HBM assembly. However, the exact progress of these projects is unknown.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 series launch and pre-order dates leak again
items.summary: Another day, another Galaxy S26 leak. Earlier this month, a report detailed the expected launch and sale dates for Samsungâ€™s upcoming flagship lineup. Now, a new leak sheds light on the launch and pre-order timeline specifically for South Korea. Firstly, prominent tipster Ice Universe reiterates thâ€¦

items.title: Quantum computing firm dangles $22,500 Bitcoin prize â€” all you have to do is uncover a private key hidden inside a quantum-optimized problem
items.summary: The Quantum Advantage Challenge offers a 0.25 BTC wallet prize to anyone who can answer a specialized problem that can be solved in under two hours on todayâ€™s quantum hardware.

items.title: Jensen Huang says Nvidia has dethroned Apple as TSMCâ€™s largest customer â€” rumor suggests that the chip fab is increasing its prices for Cupertino
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang confirmed in a podcast that his company has overtaken Apple as TSMC's biggest customer, once again becoming its top client after more than 20 years.

items.title: Steam client allegedly continues sharing your status with your friends even if you set it â€˜Offline,â€™ report claims â€” setting is a â€˜UI illusionâ€™ and your friends still receive real-time updates when you log on or log off
items.summary: An anonymous blog claims that your Steam client continues broadcasting your log-on and log-off times, regardless of your privacy status. Your friends' clients just hide your profile, but your log data is still stored on the devices of other people.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to visit China as company prepares to start H200 shipments to the country â€” plans to meet with state officials unclear despite Beijing curbs on the chip
items.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is heading to China in late January for a customary Lunar New Year visit that has taken on outsized importance, as it coincides with negotiations over how many H200 AI GPUs Beijing will allow into the country amid U.S. export approval.

items.title: Creality K1C 3D printer price plummets to $399 for a fast, fully enclosed Core XY machine â€” $160 saving nets you a beginner-friendly printer packed with prosumer features
items.summary: A $160 saving can be had right now on this Creality K1C 3D printer, fully enclosed and capable of fast printing, and available for just $399 right now, just $30 off its Black Friday pricing.

items.title: Microsoft CEO says AI needs to have a wider impact or else it risks quickly losing â€˜social permissionâ€™ â€” also says that the technology should benefit more people to avoid a bubble
items.summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella discusses AI's wider impact and what it needs to do to not be a bubble.

items.title: OpenAI shows clear compute and revenue scaling to soothe investor worries as company preps for IPO â€” expenditure continues to outweigh income as 10GW buildout continues
items.summary: OpenAI links computing power to revenue and assuages investors

items.summary: Razer's superfast 8K polling Viper V3 Pro Wireless drops to its lowest ever price on Amazon

items.title: Nvidia reportedly boosts Vera Rubin performance to ward hyperscalers off AMD Instinct AI accelerators â€” increased boost clocks and memory bandwidth pushes power demand by 500 watts to 2300 watts
items.summary: Nvidia has reportedly increased the TDP of premium Rubin processors by 500W to 2.30 kW in a bid to boost clocks, memory bandwidth, and performance per Rubin GPU and per rack.

items.title: Busted ATM shows Windows 7 login page on screen â€” asks for username and password instead of PIN to dispense cash
items.summary: An ATM in Manchester, England, is still running the 17-year-old operating system for dispensing cash.

items.title: OpenAI commits to 'paying our own way' so that Stargate AI data centers don't increase energy bills â€” will fund grid upgrades and even flexible loads to reduce stress on energy supply
items.summary: OpenAI says it will ensure Stargate does not increase electricity prices in communities where it is building its data centers.

items.title: Unlucky customer buys RTX 5080, receives relabelled RTX 5060 Ti in the box instead â€” GPU was sold and shipped by Amazon, hinting at return switcheroo
items.summary: An Asus Prime RTX 5060 Ti was swapped for the RTX 5080 the customer actually ordered, with reapplied stickers to add another layer of deception. The malpractice is easy to spot as the 5060 Ti has a single 8-pin connector, while Nvidia's 80-class cards have used 16-pin connectors for a while now. Thâ€¦

items.title: What does the future hold for LIV Golf after Koepka exit?
items.summary: With the PGA Tour going on the offensive, how hard LIV's paymasters fight to keep Bryson DeChambeau may well go a long way to dictating the future credibility of its series, writes Dan Roan.

items.title: More than half of CEOs report seeing no benefits from AI deployment so far â€” only 12% of business leaders hit the jackpot of higher revenues and reduced costs
items.summary: Only a third of CEOs report getting a benefit from AI deployments, while 55% saying they get no benefit or are worse off because of it.

items.title: Nvidia accused of trying to cut a deal with Annaâ€™s Archive for highâ€‘speed access to the massive pirated book haul â€” allegedly chased stolen data to fuel its LLMs
items.summary: Nvidia has been accused of offering to pay for â€˜high-speed accessâ€™ to Annaâ€™s Archive, a notorious â€˜shadow libraryâ€™ portal, bursting with copyright-infringing materials.

items.title: Kioxia exec says the AI boom means the era of the cheap 1TB SSD is over â€”company's NAND supply is sold out for this year and likely through 2027
items.summary: Kioxia's Memory Business Director warns that the global NAND flash shortage means affordable SSDs are gone for good.

items.title: 'I'm a scary sight' - Northampton's 23-stone, one-meal man
items.summary: Northampton lock JJ van der Mescht's gainline power and 23-stone frame is fuelled by just one meal a day.

items.summary: Taiwan Vice Premier Cheng Li-chiun said that the island hopes to become a partner to the U.S. in AI, hoping that the two parties can work together "to build a high-tech supply chain for the democratic camp."

items.title: NFL play-offs - how final four can make it to Super Bowl

items.summary: Texas-based rare-earth magnet company, Noveon Magnetics, has raised $215 million from investors to expand its U.S. operations in an effort to improve American access to magnets, a rare-earth mineral crucial to producing HDDs.

With the N1 silicon powering the GB10 Superchip, it's perhaps â€¦

items.summary: As fabs get dramatically more expensive than they used to be, technology for capacity partnerships lose their appeal, so Micron buys production facility from PSMC to upgrade it and run it itself.
